page.title: 02A FARMER'S DAY AUGUST 1985
page.content: Combining is well advanced after a late start due to a record-breaking, wet summer. The oilseed rape and barley crops are already in with good yields. Wheat and pea crops are still to be harvested. The day begins at 6.30am. with breakfast. Combining continues all day; lunch and tea being taken in the fields. The farmer's wife deals with the animals. 300 ewes are run through a Formalin foot bath and some are also treated for Orf virus. Some ewes to be sold are separated. The two Suffolk rams will be turned out with the remainder with a view to starting lambing in February. The horses and dogs are exercised, the stables mucked out and the horses and chickens are fed and the eggs collected. The day finishes at 11pm. with supper in the farmhouse.
